abstract: Employees at Commercial Vehicle Group in Piedmont, Ala, vote to join United Automobile Workers union; say growing use of temporary workers at even lower wages, as well as rising health insurance costs, swayed vote; marks unusual victory in effort to unionize southern autoworkers.
lead_paragraph: Employees cited low wages, worsening benefits and the growing use of temporary workers as reasons they voted to join the United Automobile Workers union.

headline.main: Alabama Vote Is Rare Win in the South for the U.A.W.
headline.print_headline: Alabama Vote Is Rare Win in Organizing Southern Autoworkers

snippet: Employees cited low wages, worsening benefits and the growing use of temporary workers as reasons they voted to join the United Automobile Workers union.
